alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 2:42AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG NORTHERLY WINDS FOR THOMPSON PASS TO VALDEZ THURSDAY MORNING... Northerly winds 25 to 40 mph with gusts to 55 mph have developed early this morning and are expected to persist from Thompson Pass to Valdez through around noon Thursday before slowly diminishing. Expect areas of drifting and blowing snow in Valdez and along the Richardson Highway. Although not as strong as this morning, winds will remain gusty through Friday. A second round of very strong winds, with gusts to 70 mph, is possible for Thompson Pass to Valdez late Friday evening through Saturday. High winds may move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel may be hazardous, especially for high profile vehicles, and in areas of drifting and blowing snow. For the latest forecast, please visit www.weather.gov/afc For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
